faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number) and should engage a Spanish property lawyer to navigate the purchase process. Our team can provide referrals to English-speaking legal professionals experienced with international buyers.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 7-10% in additional costs including transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). Mortgage availability exists for non-residents at competitive rates. Our consultants can provide detailed cost breakdowns.
